name: Vegan Caribbean Stew
author: stronglive1
summary: A warming, savory stew that makes use of the rich flavors and vegetables of the Caribbean.
ingredients: 1 (28 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes, chopped, with liquid
¼ teaspoon ground ginger, or more to taste
¼ teaspoon dried dill weed, or more to taste
¼ teaspoon ground cumin, or to taste
1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste
1 (16 ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained
directions: Bring brown rice and water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat
Reduce heat to medium-low; cover and simmer until rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed, 45 to 50 minutes
Place   and 2 peeled whole garlic cloves in a pot; add enough water to cover
Boil until collards are tender, about 15 minutes
Combine okra, tomatoes, chayote squash, and 2 crushed garlic cloves in a separate large pot; bring to a boil and cook until okra has thawed, about 5 minutes
Reduce to a simmer; season with ground ginger, dill weed, ground cumin, and cilantro to taste
Add collard greens; simmer until flavors have blended, at least 40 minutes (1 hour for best flavor)
Mash kidney beans together with tomato paste in a bowl; add to the stew
Stir in cooked rice and mix well
Add a spoonful of flour to thicken, if desired
